item.title: Katie add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "After all," Anne had said to Marilla once, "I believe the nicest and sweetest days are not those on which anything very splendid or wonderful or exciting happens but just those that bring simple little pleasures, following one another softly, like pearls slipping off a string." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Katie add a quote by L. M. Montgomery
item.description: "It was November--the month of crimson sunsets, parting birds, deep, sad hymns of the sea, passionate wind-songs in the pines. Anne roamed through the pineland alleys in the park and, as she said, let that great sweeping wind blow the fogs out of her soul." -- L. M. Montgomery

item.title: Katie add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "She had looked her duty courageously in the face and found it a friend - as duty ever is when we meet it frankly." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Katie add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "People laugh at me because I use big words. But if you have big ideas, you have to use big words to express them, haven't you?" -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Katie add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "As she walked along she dramatized the night. There was about it a wild, lawless charm that appealed to a certain wild, lawless strain hidden deep in Emily’s nature—the strain of the gypsy and the poet, the genius and the fool." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Katie add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I'd like to add some beauty to life," said Anne dreamily. "I don't exactly want to make people KNOW more... though I know that IS the noblest ambition... but I'd love to make them have a pleasanter time because of me... to have some little joy or happy thought that would never have existed if I hadn't been born." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Katie add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "What care I if it be "wild and improbable" and "lacking in literary art"? I refuse to be any longer hampered by such canons of criticism. The one essential thing I demand of a book is that it should interest me. If it does, I forgive it every other fault." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Katie add a quote by L. M. Montgomery
item.description: "Long after Pacifiique's gay whistle had faded into the phantom of music and then into silence far up under the maples of Lover's Lane Anne stood under the willows, tasting the poignant sweetness of life when some great dread has been removed from it. The morning was a cup filled with mist and glamor. In the corner near her was a rich surprise of new-blown, crystal-dewed roses. The trills and trickles of song from the birds in the big tree above her seemed in perfect accord with her mood. A sentence from a very old, very true, very wonderful Book came to her lips, "Weeping may endure for a night but joy cometh in the morning." -- L. M. Montgomery

item.title: Katie add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I am simply a 'book drunkard.' Books have the same irresistible temptation for me that liquor has for its devotee. I cannot withstand them." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Katie add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "When I left Queen's my future seemed to stretch out before me like a straight road. I thought I could see along it for many a milestone. Now there is a bend in it. I don't know what lies around the bend, but I'm going to believe that the best does." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Katie add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "Two things cannot be in one place. Where you tend a rose, my lad, a thistle cannot grow." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett

item.title: Katie add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "These woods are lovely, dark and deep, But I have promises to keep, And miles to go before I sleep, And miles to go before I sleep." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Katie add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Katie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Katie add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Katie add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Katie add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Katie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Tell me, what is it you plan to do with your one wild and precious life?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description:
"to live in this world
you must be able to do three things to love what is mortal; to hold it
against your bones knowing your own life depends on it; and, when the time comes to let it go, to let it go" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description:
"When it's over, I want to say: all my life I was a bride married to amazement.
--from WHEN DEATH COMES" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "To pay attention, this is our endless and proper work." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description:
"When it's over, I want to say: all my life I was a bride married to amazement. I was the bridegroom, taking the world into my arms.
When it is over, I don't want to wonder if I have made of my life something particular, and real. I don't want to find myself sighing and frightened, or full of argument.
I don't want to end up simply having visited this world." -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Mary Oliver
item.description: "Do you love this world? Do you cherish your humble and silky life? Do you adore the green grass, with its terror beneath?" -- Mary Oliver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Close the door. Write with no one looking over your shoulder. Don't try to figure out what other people want to hear from you; figure out what you have to say. It's the one and only thing you have to offer." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "If we can't, as artists, improve on real life, we should put down our pencils and go bake bread." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "It's what you do that makes your soul." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Humans can be fairly ridiculous animals." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Katie add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Thanks for this day, for all birds safe in their nests, for whatever this is, for life." -- Barbara Kingsolver
